results.title: Blue water challenge
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: A stimulating and accurate portrayal of the Golden Fleece Great Circle Yacht Race, which makes a clockwise circumnavigation of Tasmania. Starting off Portsea, Victoria, in January 1980, a fleet of Australia’s leading ocean racing yachts sailon a course of over 800 miles of challenging stretches of water. It has now become the longest race which starts and finishes in Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: Blue velvet (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Fred Caruso and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: A cult classic, set in a small American town, “Blue velvet” is a disturbing, sensuous mystery concerning four very different individuals - Dorothy (Isabella Rossellini), the haunting cabaret singer with a dark and deadly secret; Sandy (Laura Dern), the detective’s daughter, who embodies the innocence in all of us; Jeffrey (Kyle McLachlan), the naive college student with a penchant for mysteries, and finally, Frank (Dennis Hopper), the psychotic killer fuelled by his own sexual fantasies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Lynch, Fred Caruso and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group

results.title: Blue steel
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Bigelow, Oliver Stone, Edward Pressman and Lightening Pictures
results.brief_description: A steadily paced thriller from director Kathryn Bigelow starring Jamie Lee Curtis as Megan Turner, a recently graduated New York cop who is stalked by the same murdering mad man that she is investigating. An outcast in her family and in constant difficulty when it comes to relationships as a result of her occupation, suffering chastisement even within the career path she has devoted herself to, the start of a new passionate romance with Eugene Hunt (Ron Silver) has all the appearance of a turn around in her fortunes. However, little is as it seems and with the help of a fellow officer she is forced to confront her obsessive nemesis and her own self-doubts and fears. This film is a suspenseful and psychological drama with an unexpected and insightful angle on the nature of human needs and desires and the complexities of human relationships in the contemporary and ever anonymous city. Kathryn Bigelow develops a dream-like perspective on the characters and turn of events in the film, an early example of her fluid style of direction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kathryn Bigelow, Oliver Stone, Edward Pressman and Lightening Pictures

results.title: Blue pullman
results.creator_credit: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey, British Information Services and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the businessman’s first class express, the new 90 m.p.h. diesel Pullman. Undergoing its preliminary trials between London and Manchester, the features of the train demonstrate themselves with almost no commentary, and the final sequence shows the train in action seen from the air, and from the driver’s cabin.

results.title: Blue murder [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael Jenkins, Rod Allan, Southern Star Entertainment, AFFC and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Based on the events that led to the Royal Commission on Police Corruption in New South Wales, “Blue Murder” is a rivetting and exceptionally well executed thriller about police corruption and gangland criminal activity in Australia. The convincing script by Ian David focuses on both the intricacies of corruption in the police force, as well as examining the sometimes Byzantine behaviour and “moral” codes of the organised crime world. Richard Roxburgh is outstanding as Roger Rogerson, the larrikin police chief whose egalitarian blokey demeanor allows him to build a lucrative “alternative” career based on bribery, drug money and murder. Tony Martin is Neddy Smith, one of Australia’s most notorious underworld thugs who, by being the conduit between the police and the criminal underworld, is able to build an extensive drug empire in Australia. Rogerson and Smith’s activities are threatened when a young police officer, Michael Drury (Steve Bastoni), declines a bribe offered to him by Rogerson. From that moment on, “Blue Murder” depicts how Drury’s involvement in acting as an informer on Rogerson’s activities led to increasing desperate and murderous acts by both police and crims. Acclaimed internationally as a landmark television mini-series, “Blue Murder” was for years unable to be screened in NSW or available for view on video in Australia due to elements of the story being seen as prejudicial to legal trials in NSW and Federal Courts. Apart from the leads, the mini-series features excellent performances by Alex Dimitriades, Peter Phelps and John Hargreaves.

results.title: Blue Mountains: moving memories: 1920's - 1970's
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: The National Film and Sound Archive has assembled a superb compilation of historic footage which follows the growth and development of the Blue Mountains, one of the most spectacular natural features of the Australian continent. Original commentary has been retained and music selected by the NFSA has been added to the silent segments. The footage has been gleaned from home movies, documentaries and newsreels and amongst the many items of interest is the feature on Norman Lindsay’s house and garden.

results.title: Blue mould of tobacco
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Recommended methods of controlling the Blue Mould disease which is a fungus living on tobacco plants. The disease is widespread in the Australian tobacco industry. Samples of infected plants; how it is spread; the use of benzol vapour as recommended by Research Officers; fertilizing the soil; irrigation by furrow and boom spray methods; helicopter and plane spraying; the work of the Research Laboratories which test suspected plants; and work towards breeding a blue mould resistant strain of tobacco.

results.title: Blue like an orange
results.brief_description: Puppets of the Orient and the Occident are presented in this UNESCO contribution to understanding between East and West. Scenes of puppet plays in India, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, Laos, Poland, Czechoslovakia and the United States today. The presentations illustrate the great variety of the traditions which have survived for thousands of years. Also includes archival footage of Jim Henson and “the muppets” including a very early Kermit.

results.title: Blue in the face
results.creator_credit: Paul Auster, Wayne Wang, Diana Phillips, Peter Newman, Greg Johnson and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Director Wayne Wang and screenwriter Paul Auster team up again for the follow up movie from “Smoke”. This film once again centres on the Brooklyn corner Cigar Store and manager Auggie Wren (Harvey Keitel), although most of the other characters are different. Plotlines follow Auggie’s frustrated wife, Dot (Roseanne), and her attempts to seduce her husband. Also included are appearances by Jim Jarmusch, who shows up as a man about to smoke his last cigarette, and Lily Tomlin as a man with chest hair, obsessed with acquiring a Belgian waffle. Cast also includes Madonna, Michael J. Fox, Lou Reed (as himself) and Mira Sorvino.
